intro: Cyphostemma reedii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, followed by orange or red berries. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Cyphostemma reedii is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
